work.name: Sam Ling's lab, Department of Psychological Brain and Sciences, Boston University

education.area: Department of Psychological Brain and Sciences
education.studyType: PhD program in Brain, Behavior, and Cognition

publications.name: Multiple attentional control settings at distinct locations without the confounding of repetition priming
publications.summary: This study demonstrates that observers can simultaneously maintain multiple attentional control settings at different spatial locations without being confounded by repetition priming.

publications.name: Attentional Orienting by Non-informative Cue Is Shaped via Reinforcement Learning
publications.summary: This study investigated how attentional orienting induced by non-informative cues can be shaped by reinforcement learning.

publications.name: Uncertainty modulates value-driven attentional capture
publications.summary: This paper explores how uncertainty influences value-driven attentional capture.

projects.name: Exogenous Attention
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
